    "body": "You can run https://www.bunkerweb.io yourself",

    "post": {
      "id": "1mdhr0z",
      "title": "European WAF alternative to AWS/Cloudflare?",
      "body": "We’re hosting a quite large application distributed across around 20 VPS inside Hetzner Cloud behind a single Hetzner load balancer which also terminates SSL.\n\nIt’s a bummer that Hetzner’s load balancers do not offer any WAF-like protection at all.\n\nAnd regulations prohibit — and I personally refuse — to put an American Man-in-the-middle like Cloudflare’s WAF between us and our clients. Especially if that said MITM terminates client-side SSL traffic. Which is needed for most WAF features.\n\nNow I wonder what you came up with as an alternative.\n\nPlacing a WAF in front of the LB renders the LB useless. My current approach would be to place a NGINX reverse proxy with modsecurity on every singe application VPS to handle traffic coming from the LB. But this doesn’t feel right, either.",
      "permalink": "/r/hetzner/comments/1mdhr0z/european_waf_alternative_to_awscloudflare/",
      "subreddit": "hetzner",
      "thumbnail": "",
      "author": "whomass",
      "created_utc": 1753907790,
      "over_18": false
    }
  }
